title: Prince William's air ambulance helicopter 'half a SECOND from deadly mid-air collision with drone at 1,900ft'
text:
Prince Williams has flown for the Air Ambulance Service since 2015 (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Prince William's helicopter came within half a second of a potentially deadly collision with a drone, it has been claimed. 
The frightening near-miss happened when the air ambulance was travelling at 1,900ft. 
A remote-controlled drone came within a few feet and only missed colliding with the helicopter "by chance", according to a report seen by the Mail on Sunday. 
William was not piloting the aircraft at the time - but could easily have been as he pilots it on a regular basis. 
Two pilots and three medical staff were on board the helicopter at the time, it is claimed. Experts are becoming increasingly concerned by drones in Britain's skies 
It was on its way from North London back to its base in Cambridge. 
Prince William is due to leave his job with the Air Ambulance Service in the summer to fulfill more royal duties. 
He joined as a pilot in 2015. 
Experts are becoming increasingly concerned that the proliferation of drones in Britain's skies could lead to a crash. 
Reports to police about drones have risen 352% in a year. 
There are also fears drones are being used by enterprising criminals in a variety of purposes. 
It is believed burglars are using them to scope properties and thieves to identify pin numbers. Like us on Facebook
